alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 12:43PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern San Mateo and Santa Clara counties in northern California. * WHEN...Until 330 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain affecting much of San Mateo and Santa Clara counties. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Fremont, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Redwood City, Mountain View, Milpitas, Palo Alto, Cupertino, Newark, Campbell, Menlo Park, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Los Altos, East Palo Alto, Los Altos Hills, Atherton, Woodside and Stanford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
